intro: Actinocephalus velutinus, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green or yellow in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in disturbed soils. Actinocephalus velutinus is known for its adaptability and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
